title: How to study for VITEEE - Quora
tags: Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore Exams and Tests
Vellore Institute of Technology Engineering Entrance Examination (VITEEE)

response.answer_text: The best thing about VITEEE is that you don't have to prepare exclusively for it. Prepare from NCERTs. You don't have to worry about the difficulty level of the questions. They are a mix of easy,average and difficult(less than 10%). Your basics should be clear. That would be enough because the exam doesn't test your intelligence. It tests your speed and accuracy. You might want to take a look at the mock papers or previous years questions based on VITEEE's pattern. It's not required but since you have no prior idea about the exam I would suggest so. In the end, its all relative!Do not worry much and Good Luck!

You can do the following things: Solve simple to average level questions from any source. (For physics it will be mostly formula substitution, Chemistry - NCERT enough, Mathematics - simple question of JEE-MAIN type + spheres and rank of matrix included.) You can buy a book of “ARIHANT VITEEE mock test paper”. VITEEE is easy and hence appear for the paper with calm mind. All the Best ! Regards, Anupam

VITEEE isn't too tough. You must go through previous year question papers to get to know about the pattern. Take a look at the syllabus. The syllabus is almost the same as CBSE board. Start with NCERT then solve JEE level questions. VITEEE is more of a concept based exam, it tests your basic knowledge. You need to solve 125 questions in 90 minutes. So you need to be fast and accurate. So practice accordingly.

Oh common dude!! Its not IIT it's ViT...don't focus more for this exam..quite simple to crack.Just go through your second year portion;it contains some extra topics when compared to IIT like boolean some topics in inorganic chemistry... If you are really interested in it then go through the book of Arihanth publications its more than enough...all the best ..

There is no need of seperate preparation for VITEEE .mains preparation is more than enough.Stary from NCERT text books.Practise more mock tests.Time management is important.dont read the entire 2 years syllabus refer to the booklet and prepare according to the portion.All the best
